channel.title: Curious - Digg
channel.description: Curious on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: The 'Impossible' Science Experiment That Makes Water Climb Uphill
item.description: It's not black magic, but a physical phenomenon called the leidenfrost effect.

item.title: The Forgotten Tiger King Of Harlem
item.description: Antoine Yates spent three years living peacefully inside his NYC apartment with his 'roommate' — a 450-pound Siberian tiger named Ming. Until that is, Ming's animal instincts kicked in, and he mauled Yates in the middle of their kitchen.

item.title: Man Forced To Isolate Alone In Ghost Town With Murderous Past After Being Snowed In
item.description: Brent Underwood says he is "definitely socially isolating, at least."

item.title: Los Angeles Fills Venice Skate Park With Sand In An Effort To Keep Skateboarders Out During Quarantine
item.description: The county beach workers filled up the Venice Skatepark with sand.

item.title: The Slow Mo Guys Attempt To Break The Upper Limit Of YouTube's Compression Algorithm
item.description: Can the Slow Mo Guys break your YouTube?

item.title: We Aren't Sure Whether This Potato Chip Omelette Hack Is The Worst Idea Ever Or Something Fun To Try
item.description: The food influencers at Chefclub came up with this, er, unconventional way to cook a Crispy Potato Chip Omelette, which is being hailed online as either brilliant or a crime against humanity.

item.title: A Demonstration Of How Easy It Is For Canadians To Receive Financial Relief Related To The Coronavirus
item.description: The surprisingly simple way to apply for the Canadian stimulus check.

item.title: Guy Notices A Fun Coincidence With The Super Mario Bros. Flagpole Fanfare Music And The Power-Up Sound Effect
item.description: Did Nintendo composer Koji Kondo hide an Easter egg inside Super Mario Bros.?

item.title: Watch Air Bubbles Move Through This 20-Million-Year-Old Amber Fossil
item.description: We've seen amber fossils with insects embedded in them before, but we've never seen one that contains air bubbles like this one.

item.title: The Sound Of Documents Being Shredded Will Give You Warm Nostalgia For Your Old Office
item.description: A Redditor shared a video shredding 20-year-old documents and it's an ASMR experience like no other.

item.title: What Happens If You Put A Light Bulb In The Microwave?
item.description: The hosts of The King Of Random find out that age-old question: what happens if you put a light bulb in the microwave?

item.title: A Computer Whiz Jerry-Rigged A 1930 Model 15 Teletype As A Linux Terminal And It's Quite Impressive
item.description: An extremely patient techie set up a 1930s teletype to be used as a Linux TTY interface.
item.kicker: SOMEONE SEND THIS TO TOM HANKS

item.title: The Performance Of A $40 Yeti-Brand Plastic Bucket Compared With A Generic Plastic Bucket You'd Get At A Hardware Store
item.description: A YouTuber puts two buckets through the ringer and observes whether the Yeti brand bucket is worth the investment.

item.title: This Seemingly Unending Line At Costco Is The Way We All Live Now
item.description: If you were hoping to pick up some supplies at Costco in Brooklyn, New York, we have some bad news for you.
item.kicker: AND I THINK IT'S GOING TO BE A LONG, LONG TIME

item.title: Here's Some Face-Down Card Games You Can Play With Yourself
item.description: Matt Parker demonstrates a card game you can play while you're alone.
item.kicker: THE TIMING ON THIS IS IMPECCABLE

item.title: Keirin School: Inside The Strict And Secret World Of Bicycle Racing In Japan
item.description: Keirin racing in Japan is a big business that is rich in traditions too. Its intriguing world says a lot about our Olympics hosts.

item.title: How The World's Squarest Fish Gets Around
item.description: The yellow boxfish is much more agile than it looks.

item.title: This Hummer H2 Looks Hilariously Top Heavy When Affixed With Puny 13-Inch Wheels
item.description: The Hummer H2 loses a foot of ground clearance when the cheeky pranksters at Garage 54 trade in its standard wheels for 13-inch ones.

item.title: Kinetic Artist Builds Rube Goldberg Machine For Passing The Pepper While Social Distancing At The Dinner Table
item.description: Joseph Herscher has a clever way of getting the pepper with a very elaborate contraption.

item.title: Dog Walker Finds Clever Way To Stay Safe When Out-And-About In The Neighborhood
item.description: Just a typical day in Nashua, New Hampshire.

item.title: How This Dubious 'Doctor' Became 'The Most Quoted Human On The Planet'
item.description: Steve Maraboli has spent the last two decades building an online empire of self-mythology — and it's almost entirely false.

item.title: YouTuber Builds DIY Water Coolant To Help Prevent The World's Brightest LED From Burning Out
item.description: Matt from DIY Perks constructs a genius water coolant from scratch to help regulate the power of this 1500 watt LED.

item.title: This Guy And His Mom's Trick Shot Attempt With A Series Of Pots And Pans Is Thrilling
item.description: While in quarantine, a mom and her son hatched together a highly intricate setup of pots and pans in effort to sink a ping pong ball into a red solo cup.

item.title: This Video Of A New Jersey Cowboy Showing Off His Fancy Horsemanship Is The Most Delightful Video You'll Watch Today
item.description: It's not every day that you see this at the intersection.

item.title: How This 2001 Volvo Got Stuck On A Tiny Island In A Flooded Strip Mine — And Stayed There For 8 Years
item.description: The solitary Volvo has lorded over its little isle since early January 2012.

item.title: I Think About Joe Pesci's Rap Career A Lot
item.description: Why did he feel the need to make a lavish music video? Did the GoodFellas star think he needed a side hustle?

item.title: 'Back To The Future' Fans Recreated The Sequel Scene-For-Scene While Under Quarantine And The Result Is An Epic Hodgepodge
item.description: The 88 Project brought together 300 people from 9 different countries filming 88 scenes from "Back to the Future Part II."

item.title: How To Make A Stunning Looking Cereal Commercial While Quarantined At Home
item.description: Daniel Schiffer demonstrates how to make a high-quality Cheerios commercial alone in his house.

item.title: That Time Vice Paid A 'Hacker' $5,000 For A Fake Rob Ford Story
item.description: It was one of their biggest Canadian scoops. They didn't know they were being conned.

item.title: Russian Boats Are Just A Little Bit Different…
item.description: Was this… intentional? They seem pretty chill about it.

item.title: Katie Nolan Asked Her ESPN Buds To See Who Could Get The Most Famous Person To Join Her Zoom Chat And It Went Off The Rails
item.description: Who can get the most famous celebrity to join Kate Nolan's Zoom chat? After a while, the whole thing snowballs out of control.

item.title: This Pilot Took Rare Aerial Photos Of Area 51
item.description: Private pilot Gabriel Zeifman took to the skies this past weekend and captured some rare aerial photos of Area 51.

item.title: This Man Set A New World Bench Press Record While Fully Submerged Underwater
item.description: Greg Wittstock performed the most consecutive reps of a bench press while completely underwater.

item.title: Please Enjoy This Extremely Relaxing Live Cam Of A Train Cabin Driver's Front View In Norway
item.description: Take a ride on the Nordland Railway from Trondheim to Bodø, minute by minute.

item.title: Justin Timberlake Will Never Forget What Marilyn Manson Told Him At A Party
item.description: The pop star has fun eating spicy wings, ranking his albums and telling an amusing anecdote about the shock rocker.
item.kicker: 'PLEASE DON'T TELL ANYONE I TOLD YOU THAT'

item.title: How Did England Get Its Bizarro Street Names?
item.description: For your consideration: "Gropecunt Lane."
item.kicker: A STREET BY ANY OTHER NAME...

item.title: My Year Of Free Mattresses
item.description: I slept on a new one every 100 nights, but I couldn't scam my way to self-care.

item.title: Bird Rehabber Teaches European Starling To Speak Words, And It's Pretty Wild
item.description: European starlings are astonishingly good at mimicking sounds. This intrepid wildlife rehabber taught it to say words related to its introduction to North America.

item.title: Filmmaker Reacts To The Incredibly Realistic Scenes In Movies That Are Actually Special Effects
item.description: Peter McKinnon is continually shocked by the extremely real looking fake scenes in modern Hollywood features.
item.kicker: EVEN BETTER THAN THE REAL THING

item.title: What It Was Like To Be Inside The Sinking Jungle Cruise At Disney World
item.description: Back in February, the Jungle Cruise in Walt Disney World sprung a leak. It wasn't so funny for guests who unfortunately found themselves onboard.

item.title: Inside The 'Circus Capital Of The World'
item.description: The big top came to Peru, Indiana in the late 19th century. It never left.

item.title: It's Gotta Be Fake, But This Video Of Three UFOs Orbiting The Moon Is Still Giving Us The Creeps
item.description: Credit to the CGI master out there making the most of quarantine to mess with our heads. On the other hand, with the way 2020 is going, it's hard to say UFOs would be a big surprise.
item.kicker: NOT A GOOD TIME FOR A VISIT, ET

item.title: Musician Attempts To Play The Guitar With A Violin Bow And Starts To Sound Like Sigur Rós
item.description: After a little trial and error (and a lot of rosin), Tyler Larson creates some beautiful music with a violin bow and a guitar.

item.title: This 'Open The Lock' Logic Puzzle Is Stumping The Internet. Can You Solve It?
item.description: In this viral logic puzzle, you have to open a lock using five numerical clues. Here's how to solve the riddle that's stumping the internet.

item.title: A Probability Comparison Of The Rarest Things In The Universe
item.description: An interesting visualization comparing different rare occurrences.

item.title: A YouTuber Attempts To Get Ripped In 30 Days By Using Only Virtual Reality-Based Body Weight Workouts
item.description: Ryan Trahan found himself quarantined inside and wanted to test whether he could get ripped using only VR.

item.title: Wipe Out: The Curious History Of Toilet Paper
item.description: Although it may seem like a product that we've always been reliant upon, toilet paper has not actually been around very long, and may not be as essential as we think it is. Instead, it's the product of very good marketing.

item.title: This Video Of Teenage Metalheads Shopping At A Record Store In 1989 Feels Like A Relic Of A Lost Civilization
item.description: Music-loving adolescents in Huntsville, Alabama have fun with a video camera in 1989.

item.title: Ford Needs Your Help Figuring Out What's Up With This Mysterious Mid-Engine Mustang Prototype
item.description: A set of photos from 1966 has left Mustang experts reeling over what this two-seater concept might be.

item.title: Outdoor Survivalist Reveals A MacGyver-Like Technique To Catching A Fish With A Mouse Trap
item.description: Canadian outdoor recreationalist Greg Ovens demonstrates a curious method for hooking trout.
item.kicker: MORE THAN ONE WAY TO CATCH A FISH
